resources.string:
The menstrual cycle is a natural, recurring process that occurs in the bodies of individuals with female reproductive systems.

Typically lasting around 28 days, though it can vary, the menstrual cycle involves a series of hormonal and physiological changes designed to prepare the body for potential pregnancy.

The cycle is divided into several phases, including Menstruation, Follicular, Ovulation, and Luteal phases.

Menstruation marks the shedding of the uterine lining, while the follicular phase sees the development of a new egg.

Ovulation is the release of the mature egg, and the luteal phase prepares the uterus for a potential fertilized egg.

Iron-rich Foods:

Lean meats (chicken, turkey)
Fish (especially salmon and tuna)
Lentils and beans
Leafy green vegetables (spinach, kale)

Hydration:

Drink plenty of water to stay hydrated, which can help alleviate bloating.
